required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing the Performance of 1 Day Multifocal Contact Lenses
clinical_study.official_title: Comparing the Performance of 1 Day Multifocal Contact Lenses

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to compare the lens handling and performance of Lens A to habitually worn multifocal contact lenses and to the competitor Lens B.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of the study is to compare the lens handling and performance of Lens A to habitually worn multifocal contact lenses and to the competitor Lens B. This is a prospective, randomized, participant-masked, crossover, bilateral dispensing study conducted at up to 5 clinical practice sites in the United States. Each lens type will be worn for up to 3 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Subjective at-home ratings of Lens handling for insertion
primary_outcome.description: Subjective at-home ratings of Lens handling for insertion will be assessed using a 0-10 scale,

arm_group.description: Subjects will be randomized to wear Lens A (test) then Lens B (control) for 3 weeks in this randomized, cross-over bilateral dispensing study.
Subjects will be randomized to wear Lens B (control) then Lens A (test) for 3 weeks in this randomized, cross-over bilateral dispensing study.

intervention.description: Subjects will be randomized to wear Lens A (test) for 3 weeks.
Subjects will be randomized to wear Lens B (control) for 3 weeks.

overall_contact.last_name: Jose A. Vega, O.D., MSc., FAAO
